headline.main: Legislatures in 12 States to Consider Plans to Strengthen Antipollution Laws

results.snippet: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 2 -- In at least a dozen states, proposals for stiffer laws to combat air and water pollution will be submitted to new legislative sessions this year.

byline.original: By GLADWIN HILLSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 2 -- In at least a dozen states, proposals for stiffer laws to combat air and water pollution will be submitted to new legislative sessions this year.

results.abstract: NASA announces launching of US Apollo 16 mission will be delayed from Mar 17 until Apr 16 because of problems with mechanism used during separation of command and lunar modules in lunar orbit and detection of abnormal variability in lunar module's battery capacity; says minor design changes in spacesuits worn by astronauts on lunar surface will also be necessary

headline.main: Apollo 16 Delayed to April 16 By Defect in Separating Device

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 -- The National Aeronautics and Space Administration announced today a one-month delay in the launching of the Apollo 16 manned flight to the moon.

byline.original: By HAROLD M. SCHMECK Jr.Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 -- The National Aeronautics and Space Administration announced today a one-month delay in the launching of the Apollo 16 manned flight to the moon.

headline.main: Karsh's Camera Aims at Person Behind Face

results.snippet: OTTAWA, Jan. 7 -- Of all the performers Yousuf Karsh has photographed, "the most natural" was Joan Baez. Meeting him after an exhausting day of student upheaval at Stanford University, the folk singer requested and was granted time for a nap before...

byline.original: By JAY WALZSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA, Jan. 7 -- Of all the performers Yousuf Karsh has photographed, "the most natural" was Joan Baez. Meeting him after an exhausting day of student upheaval at Stanford University, the folk singer requested and was granted time for a nap before having her picture taken by "Karsh of Ottawa."

results.abstract: Program at Woodward organized by group of mothers of children at school to end ways in which children, mostly girls, are limited intellectually through soc and traditional sexual attitudes that are passed on or reinforced by school described; future plans by group, which is called Sex Roles Com, include women's studies course, special section on women in school library, feminist newsletter for school and consciousness-raising sessions with girls

results.snippet: Philadelphia's new mayor, Frank L. Rizzo, says that perhaps the city should have "our own electric chair." Noting that Pennsylvania's electric chair was dismantled last year on orders of Fred Peaker, the former Attorney General, Mr. Rizzo, a former...
results.lead_paragraph: Philadelphia's new mayor, Frank L. Rizzo, says that perhaps the city should have "our own electric chair." Noting that Pennsylvania's electric chair was dismantled last year on orders of Fred Peaker, the former Attorney General, Mr. Rizzo, a former police commissioner, said that maybe the state needed a local option law on capital punishment.

headline.main: NEW CHIEF NAMED AT SPACE CENTER; Kraft Gets Gilruth's Job at Houston Facility -- Aldrin Leaving the Air Force

results.snippet: Dr. Robert R. Gilruth, head of the space agency's Manned Spacecraft Center in Houston from its inception through five moon landings, has turned over the post to Dr. Christopher C. Kraft Jr., the crisp-voiced flight director of America's early manned...
results.lead_paragraph: Dr. Robert R. Gilruth, head of the space agency's Manned Spacecraft Center in Houston from its inception through five moon landings, has turned over the post to Dr. Christopher C. Kraft Jr., the crisp-voiced flight director of America's early manned missions.

results.snippet: US Apollo 15 astronauts Maj Worden and Col Scott arrive, Warsaw, beginning 6-day goodwill visit in Poland; will meet with Polish scientists; will be joined later in wk by Lt Col Irwin

results.abstract: US NASA names crews for 3 earth-orbital Skylab missions; veteran astronaut Capt Conrad will command 1st crew; other members will be Comdr Weitz and physician-astronaut Dr J P Kerwin; Capt Bean will command 2d crew; will be accompanied on mission by Maj Lousma and scientist-astronaut Dr O K Garriott; Lt Col Carr selected as comdr of 3d crew, which will also include Lt Col Pogue and scientist-astronaut Dr E G Gibson; $2-billion Skylab project will employ modified Apollo rockets and spacecraft and will give astronauts and scientists experience living and working for long periods in space; will be 1st US space program to make extensive use of scientists on missions; space station workshop will have 3 times as much room as Apollo command module and will be divided into working, sleeping and eating compartments on 2 floors; attached to workshop will be solar telescope unit and docking apparatus that will serve as connecting link between workshop and Apollo command module; primary task of 1st crew will be to study physiological and psychological aspects of 28-day stay in space; 2d mission, scheduled to last 56 days, will be devoted primarily to operating solar telescope; 3d crew will survey earth resources with highly sensitive cameras; all 3 missions, which will use same Skylab workshop, should be completed by end of '73

headline.main: 3 SKYLAB CREWS CHOSEN BY NASA; Orbiting Workshop of Earth to Be Launched in 1973

results.snippet: The astronaut crews for Skylab, the nation's post-Apollo, experimental space station project, were announced yesterday by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.
results.lead_paragraph: The astronaut crews for Skylab, the nation's post-Apollo, experimental space station project, were announced yesterday by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

headline.main: AIR FORCE NAMES A BLACK GENERAL; Woman and Astronaut Also Elevated to Star Rank

headline.main: There Are No Sexists On 'Sesame Street'; ' Sesame Street'

results.snippet: SHOULD "Sesame Street's" Bert and Ernie be replaced by Bertha and Ernestine? Should a governess -- or, better, a male child care specialist -deal with Roosevelt Franklin at home, while his mother runs for President of the United States on a Women's...

byline.original: By GRACE and FRED M. HECHINGER

results.lead_paragraph: SHOULD "Sesame Street's" Bert and Ernie be replaced by Bertha and Ernestine? Should a governess -- or, better, a male child care specialist -deal with Roosevelt Franklin at home, while his mother runs for President of the United States on a Women's Liberation ticket?
